intro: Phacelia perityloides var. jaegeri, commonly known as Jaeger's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has small, ovate leaves with a pubescent surface, and its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. This species is often used in restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and attract pollinators.
